results.title: The Prince and the pauper (1937)
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Robert Lord and William Keighley
results.brief_description: Set in Tudor London, Edward IV, Price of Wales, is only thirteen years old, yet he is heir to the throne. For amusement, he changes his clothes with Tom, a pauper, who bears an uncanny resemblance to him. Circumstances, however, conspire to turn their childish prank into a dangerous game. Stars Errol Flynn and Claude Rains. Based on the novel by Mark Twain.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Warner Bros Pictures, Robert Lord and William Keighley

results.title: The Prince and the pauper
results.creator_credit: A P I Television Productions, Walter J Hucker and Chris Cuddington
results.brief_description: Set in Tudor London, Edward IV, Price of Wales, is only thirteen years old, yet he is heir to the throne. Some rather unexpected events take place when, for amusement, he changes his clothes with Tom, a pauper, who bears an uncanny resemblance to him. Made for television this animated film is based on the story by American writer, Mark Twain.

results.title: The Prince
results.creator_credit: Barr Media Group and Bill Jersey
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Renaissance”.
Documents the lives and accomplishments of the “Princes” of the Renaissance. Discover the motivations and political solutions of leaders such as Cosimo di Medici, Prince Philip of Spain and Queen Elizabeth of England. Learn about Machiavelli, a maligned political theorist, but one of the most influential figures in the politics of his age. Furthermore, explore the Renaissance leaders legacy that continues to influence today’s statesmen.

results.title: The Primary cell
results.brief_description: Animation s used to explain the operation of the dry cell in terms of electron action, including ionisation of the electrolyte, electron flow through a circuit, action at electrodes, polarization and depolarisation. Demonstrations reveal the operating characteristics of a cell and of several cells (as in a battery) in both series and parallel connexions.

results.title: The Price of hunger
results.creator_credit: Kent Smith Studio, Barr Films and Kent Smith
results.brief_description: Documents the problem of worldwide hunger, its causes and solutions. Looks at how Third World governments trade the lives and health of their people for personal gain, how Western foreign policy supports corrupt Third World governments and how multinational corporations use business practices which often rob the poor of their land and food. Also shows how improved farming methods not dependent upon extensive energy and technology or foreign investment could help reduce hunger. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Price of fire
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Bruce Parsons
results.brief_description: Filmed under great difficulty and risk in Montreal’s worst fire zone, this film argues, in ways no audience can ignore, the case for inspection and prevention. It is a strong reminder of the price of carelessness and the need for vigilance, especially during winter months when fire hazards are at their height.

results.title: The Price of a life
results.creator_credit: American Foundation Institute of Corrections, Vission Associates, Frank Loveland and Lee R. Bobker
results.brief_description: Docudrama which explores probation in the correctional systems in the United States. Traces the entire probation process through the case history of an offender on his way to becoming a habitual criminal. Considers means and methods by which probation can be strengthened and made more effective. A sequel to The Odds Against. Stars Martin Sheen in main role.

results.creator_credit: Searle Education Systems and Peter Glushanok

results.title: The Pressure of light
results.brief_description: Light pressure on a thin foil suspended in high vacuum sets the foil into oscillation. It leads up to this by a discussion of the Crookes radiometer and the effect - not light pressure - that causes it to rotate. The role of light pressure in the universe is also briefly discussed.
